特記事項: 【合併】English Communication VI　Ａ（総合政策学部）/英語コミュニケーションVI　Ａ（総合政策学部）
授業方法: Materials, instruction, and all class communication are in English. Course materials will be available to students through LUNA.

トピック.授業計画1:
*All 14 classes will be conducted face-to-face.
<Lecture> Each topic will be introduced on a four-week cycle following a problem - solution genre. The first week, will introduce an SDG, providing background information and important definitions. The second week will address the causes of the problem and the interrelatedness of the topic with other SDGs. The third and fourth weeks will introduce solutions to the problem and discuss the successes and limitations. 
<Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion>Materials and topics will follow the lecture course while also introducing discussion skills and improving vocabulary knowledge. 
<Lecture Bridge Reading and Writing> The majority of the course will be spent researching, summarizing and writing an academic problem-solution essay. The schedule for each Special Topics course will depend on the teacher and will be announced to students at the beginning of the class.
トピック.授業外学習2:
<Lecture> Students will read and complete preparation worksheets for each lecture. Students will need to review materials throughout the semester. 
<Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion> To prepare for the discussions, students will read articles, attend the lectures, and research the topic on the Internet In the discussions, they present, discuss, and explore the topics based on the lecture, reading, and research. 
<Lecture Bridge Reading and Writing> Students write a problem-solution essay as well as read articles and prepare for in-class tests. 
<Special Topics> Each Special Topics course will have different homework associated with the topic.

評価.教科書Required texts0: Materials will be available on LUNA. You should bring your materials to class on your device (computer / tablet) or print and bring paper copies. If you do not bring a device, you should also bring a dictionary to class.Materials will be available on LUNA. Some special topics courses may require other materials. Your teacher will let you know on the first day of class if you need to purchase anything extra.
